result.execSummary:
The defendant Cyndi Cleo Lentz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.44(1)(b).
  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Total financial obligations for both counts is $1,148.00 less $527 to be applied = $621 to be paid at a rate of $100 per mth comm 9-1-22 or civil judgment and referral to State Debt Collections.

With good time and Huber release.
May be served in Brown Co, if Deft makes arrangements with MCJ.

records.addlTxt:
2:00 PM Prosecuting attorney Mitchell John Philbin in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Cyndi Cleo Lentz in court.  Attorney Quinn T Jolly in court for Cyndi Cleo Lentz. 
ADA is heard on agreement, Def to plead to Ct 1 & 2, dismiss & read-in Ct 3
ADA reads Ct 1; Court arraigns Def; Def pleads No Contest
ADA reads Ct 2; Court arraigns Def; Def pleads No Contest
Non-citizenship warning
Court is heard on maximum penalties
Elements
Plea quest & WOR
Constitutional rights
Court reviews read-in charge
ADA verifies No claim for restitution
Factual basis
Parties agree -Jt recommendation
Court finds pleas were made freely, vol & intelligently
Court accepts pleas and finds Def guilty of Ct 1 & 2; Ct 3 dismissed & read-in
ADA is heard on sentencing
Atty Jolly is heard on sentencing
Requests jail time to be served in Brown Co.
Court sentence:
Ct 1 -Pay fine $200 + costs + DNA surch = $705.00
10 days jail w/Good time & w/Huber comm 10/11/22 7pm
Ct 2 -Pay costs + DNA surch
30 days jail, concurrent to Ct 1
Jail time can be served in Brown Co, if Def makes arrangements with MCJ
No credit for time served
Financial ob = $1148.00, paymt $527 to be applied; balance to be pd @ $100/mo comm 09/01/22 or CJ & SDC
Submit to DNA sample by 10/11/22
Appeal rights

Court calls case. 
Atty spks- case has been resolved. 
Requests plea/sent to be scheduled. 
Court schedules with parties. 
2:37 PM
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 16, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Letter to Judge - Quinn Jolly Sick

8:27 AM Prosecuting attorney DeShea D. Morrow in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Quinn T Jolly in court for Cyndi Cleo Lentz. 
Court calls case. 
Atty Spks- case has been resolved. 
Has reviewed copy of complaint with Deft. 
Deft is aware of max penalties and charges. 
Waives further reading. 
Enters NG Plea.
Requests Plea/sent. 
Court schedules with parties. 
8:29 AM
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 25, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on June 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.

01:38 PM Defendant Cyndi Cleo Lentz in court.  DeShea D. Morrow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court calls case.
ADA provides copy of complaint.
Court reviews charges and max penalties.
Court inquires on atty.
Deft to contact the PD's office today.
Clerk provides contact information.
Court schedules with parties.
ADA heard on bond recommendation.
Deft heard.
Court imposes $1000 signature bond w/ conditions, sign waiver of extradition, no possession or consumption of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid Rx, no operating a motor vehicle without a valid license.
Court schedules with parties.
1:44 PM
